The terrorists, identified as Suleman, Afghan, and Jibran, were A-category members of Lashkar-e-Taiba. Investigation involved questioning over a thousand individuals, creating composite sketches, and detaining those who provided food and shelter to the terrorists. ]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/all-from-pakistan-amit-shah-reveals-details-of-operation-mahadev-shares-how-3-pahalgam-terrorists-were-identified/articleshow/122969890.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/all-from-pakistan-amit-shah-reveals-details-of-operation-mahadev-shares-how-3-pahalgam-terrorists-were-identified/articleshow/122969890.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 12:56:47 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1059725" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122970173,imgsize-1059725.cms"/></item><item><title>'We have proof': Shah slams Chidambaram's 'homegrown' terrorists remark; asks whom does he want to save?</title><description><![CDATA[In a Lok Sabha showdown, Amit Shah strongly refuted P Chidambaram's doubts regarding Pakistan's role in the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor. Shah presented evidence, including NIA arrests and FSL reports, confirming the terrorists' identities and their Pakistani origin. He accused Chidambaram of giving Pakistan a clean chit and undermining the investigation.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/we-have-proof-amit-shah-slams-chidambarams-homegrown-terrorists-remark-asks-whom-does-he-want-to-save/articleshow/122970391.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/we-have-proof-amit-shah-slams-chidambarams-homegrown-terrorists-remark-asks-whom-does-he-want-to-save/articleshow/122970391.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 13:43:07 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1261823" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122970904,imgsize-1261823.cms"/></item><item><title>'Ill-timed': US shuns UN 2-state solution conference; conveys concerns with India</title><description><![CDATA[The United States has expressed reservations to India regarding the UN 2-state conference, deeming it counterproductive to ending the Gaza conflict and securing hostage releases. Despite US urging, India is participating, seeking constructive engagement towards a 2-state solution. India balances its ties with Israel and its support for the Palestinian cause, advocating for a negotiated resolution.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/us-shuns-ill-timed-un-conference-for-2-state-solution-conveys-concerns-to-india/articleshow/122966937.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/us-shuns-ill-timed-un-conference-for-2-state-solution-conveys-concerns-to-india/articleshow/122966937.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 10:53:01 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>SACHIN PARASHAR</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1454722" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122967139,imgsize-1454722.cms"/></item><item><title>'If you don't understand my silence ...': Fresh rift within Congress? Manish Tewari post adds to speculation</title><description><![CDATA[Congress MP Manish Tewari's cryptic social media posts have ignited speculation about internal divisions within the party, particularly regarding national security issues. His silence during a crucial Lok Sabha debate on Operation Sindoor, coupled with Shashi Tharoor's abstention and reported internal criticism, suggests a lack of unified stance within the Congress leadership.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/if-you-dont-understand-my-silence-fresh-rift-within-congress-manish-tewari-responds-to-question-on-cryptic-post/articleshow/122969442.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/if-you-dont-understand-my-silence-fresh-rift-within-congress-manish-tewari-responds-to-question-on-cryptic-post/articleshow/122969442.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 12:53:24 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="909756" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122969568,imgsize-909756.cms"/></item><item><title>TCS layoffs: Former Tech Mahindra CEO CP Gurnani quotes Sholay line</title><description><![CDATA[Amidst TCS layoffs, CP Gurnani urges the Indian tech industry to move beyond headcount obsession and embrace outcome-based models. He emphasizes a shift from the traditional pyramid structure, advocating for enhanced productivity, specialized skills, and advanced technological capabilities. Experts suggest that upskilling and reskilling are crucial for tech professionals in this evolving landscape.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/tcs-layoffs-former-tech-mahindra-ceo-cp-gurnani-quotes-sholay-line-and-sends-a-message-to-techies/articleshow/122970365.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/tcs-layoffs-former-tech-mahindra-ceo-cp-gurnani-quotes-sholay-line-and-sends-a-message-to-techies/articleshow/122970365.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 13:11:01 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI TECH DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="30336" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122970349,imgsize-30336.cms"/></item><item><title>'Will step in if there is mass exclusion': SC fixes timeline for considering pleas against SIR</title><description><![CDATA[]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/will-step-in-if-there-is-mass-exclusion-sc-fixes-timeline-for-considering-pleas-against-bihar-sir-hearing-on-august-12/articleshow/122968033.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/will-step-in-if-there-is-mass-exclusion-sc-fixes-timeline-for-considering-pleas-against-bihar-sir-hearing-on-august-12/articleshow/122968033.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 11:45:38 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1701173" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122968075,imgsize-1701173.cms"/></item><item><title>'Absolute filth, embarrassing moment': Stuart Broad on Harry Brook's over where he bowled 37mph</title><description><![CDATA[Stuart Broad criticized England's tactics during the fourth Test against India, particularly Harry Brook's off-spin bowling, labeling it "embarrassing." Ben Stokes's attempt to speed up the match's conclusion by using Brook and bringing fielders in close drew scrutiny. While opinions diverged, the incident highlights the tension and debate surrounding England's approach as the series heads to a decisive final Test.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/absolute-filth-embarrassing-moment-stuart-broad-on-harry-brooks-over-where-he-bowled-37mph/articleshow/122970650.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/absolute-filth-embarrassing-moment-stuart-broad-on-harry-brooks-over-where-he-bowled-37mph/articleshow/122970650.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 13:39:51 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="86546" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122970729,imgsize-86546.cms"/></item><item><title>IND vs ENG: 'Why not declare after Ben Stokes' hundred?' - Sunil Gavaskar slams England's 'loud talk'</title><description><![CDATA[The drawn Test match between India and England saw heated exchanges. Sunil Gavaskar has now criticized England's tactics. He praised India's resilience, especially Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar's batting. Gavaskar questioned England's delayed declaration. He also referenced past comments from England players about chasing high scores. Gavaskar challenged Shubman Gill to question England's strategy in the post-match conference.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-why-not-declare-after-ben-stokes-hundred-sunil-gavaskar-slams-englands-loud-talk/articleshow/122969192.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-why-not-declare-after-ben-stokes-hundred-sunil-gavaskar-slams-englands-loud-talk/articleshow/122969192.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 12:31:50 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="48338" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122969328,imgsize-48338.cms"/></item><item><title>Solar Eclipse that will see the "world to go dark for six minutes" on August 2</title><description><![CDATA[Contrary to viral claims, the world won't experience a six-minute blackout on August 2, 2025. NASA confirms a total solar eclipse will occur on August 2, 2027, darkening parts of Europe, North Africa, and the Middle East.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/solar-eclipse-that-will-see-the-world-to-go-dark-for-six-minutes-on-august-2-what-nasas-update-says/articleshow/122970807.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/solar-eclipse-that-will-see-the-world-to-go-dark-for-six-minutes-on-august-2-what-nasas-update-says/articleshow/122970807.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 13:38:34 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI TECH DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1456151" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122970788,imgsize-1456151.cms"/></item><item><title>TCS layoffs: IT ministry ‘closely monitoring’ 12k job cuts, claims report</title><description><![CDATA[India's IT Ministry is closely monitoring TCS's plan to reduce its workforce by over 12,000 employees, primarily impacting middle and senior management. This restructuring, representing two percent of TCS's global staff, is part of a strategy to become a "future-ready organisation.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/tcs-layoffs-it-ministry-closely-monitoring-12000-job-cuts-claims-report-it-union-calls-tech-firms-move-illegal/articleshow/122967092.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/tcs-layoffs-it-ministry-closely-monitoring-12000-job-cuts-claims-report-it-union-calls-tech-firms-move-illegal/articleshow/122967092.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 11:20:51 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI BUSINESS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="907264" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122967578,imgsize-907264.cms"/></item><item><title>NFL under pressure to review safety measures after New York shooting; 5 killed; league faces calls for urgent action</title><description><![CDATA[A gunman's deadly rampage at the NFL's New York headquarters triggered a lockdown and claimed a police officer's life, shaking the league's operations. While no players or executives were harmed, the incident prompted immediate security enhancements and internal discussions about the future of the NFL's presence in Midtown Manhattan, including exploring options like remote work and relocation.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/nfl/news/nfl-under-pressure-to-review-safety-measures-after-new-york-headquarters-shooting-leaves-4-dead/articleshow/122968981.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/nfl/news/nfl-under-pressure-to-review-safety-measures-after-new-york-headquarters-shooting-leaves-4-dead/articleshow/122968981.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 12:28:04 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>GLOBAL SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="111364" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122969351,imgsize-111364.cms"/></item><item><title>RBI bets on gold! Central Bank buys half a tonne of gold in June</title><description><![CDATA[The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) increased its gold reserves by approximately half a tonne in late June, bringing total holdings to 879.8 tonnes. Gold's value within India's foreign exchange reserves has significantly increased, reaching 12.1% as of July 18, 2025.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/rbi-bets-on-gold-reserve-bank-of-india-buys-half-a-tonne-of-gold-in-june-yellow-metal-fastest-growing-component-of-indias-forex-reserves/articleshow/122968391.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/rbi-bets-on-gold-reserve-bank-of-india-buys-half-a-tonne-of-gold-in-june-yellow-metal-fastest-growing-component-of-indias-forex-reserves/articleshow/122968391.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 12:22:46 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI BUSINESS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="149770" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122969141,imgsize-149770.cms"/></item><item><title>Accenture executive says AI can speed up work, but won’t raise productivity unless…</title><description><![CDATA[Artificial Intelligence tools can speed up tasks. However, Accenture's Ramine Tinati says it doesn't guarantee productivity. Companies need to redesign workflows for real gains. Some Asian firms are lagging in AI adoption. Tech giants like Amazon and Microsoft are investing heavily in AI. Nvidia's Jensen Huang and OpenAI's Sam Altman believe AI will change jobs.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/accenture-executive-says-ai-can-speed-up-work-but-wont-raise-productivity-unless/articleshow/122955662.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/accenture-executive-says-ai-can-speed-up-work-but-wont-raise-productivity-unless/articleshow/122955662.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 28 Jul 2025 19:12:53 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI TECH DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="30344" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122955661,imgsize-30344.cms"/></item><item><title>Exited BMW, rifle in hand, began firing in lobby: How Manhattan shooting unfolded</title><description><![CDATA[A lone gunman, Shane Tamura, unleashed terror in Midtown Manhattan, resulting in five fatalities, including a brave police officer. Tamura, who drove from Las Vegas, initiated the carnage in a Park Avenue building, fatally shooting the officer in the lobby. He then continued his rampage, killing civilians before taking his own life on the 33rd floor.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/exited-bmw-rifle-in-hand-began-firing-in-lobby-how-manhattan-shooting-unfolded-what-went-on-inside-the-building/articleshow/122965903.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/exited-bmw-rifle-in-hand-began-firing-in-lobby-how-manhattan-shooting-unfolded-what-went-on-inside-the-building/articleshow/122965903.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 10:09:14 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1179140" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122965923,imgsize-1179140.cms"/></item><item><title>Erin Burnett comes under fire: CNN anchor misidentifies shooter as “possibly white”; Sparks backlash over premature racial speculation</title><description><![CDATA[Erin Burnett, a CNN anchor, faces criticism for identifying the Park Avenue shooter as "possibly white" during a live broadcast, contradicting initial NYPD reports describing him as "possibly Middle Eastern." This sparked a social media backlash, raising concerns about racial assumptions and media responsibility in real-time news coverage. The shooter, Shane D. Tamura, killed four before fatally shooting himself.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/nfl/news/cnns-erin-burnett-under-fire-for-misidentifying-nyc-shooters-race-in-live-nfl-hq-coverage/articleshow/122969788.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/nfl/news/cnns-erin-burnett-under-fire-for-misidentifying-nyc-shooters-race-in-live-nfl-hq-coverage/articleshow/122969788.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 12:52:10 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>GLOBAL SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="219136" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122969912,imgsize-219136.cms"/></item><item><title>Chinese company banned in America launches rival to Nvidia’s most-advanced chip</title><description><![CDATA[Huawei's CloudMatrix 384, showcased at WAIC Shanghai, is emerging as a strong competitor to Nvidia's GB200 NVL72. Despite U.S. restrictions, Huawei is becoming a key Chinese AI chip supplier. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang acknowledged Huawei's progress and warned about the impact of U.S. curbs, suggesting Huawei could dominate if restrictions persist.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/chinese-company-banned-in-america-launches-rival-to-nvidias-most-advanced-chip-read-nvidia-ceo-jensen-huangs-warning/articleshow/122956208.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/chinese-company-banned-in-america-launches-rival-to-nvidias-most-advanced-chip-read-nvidia-ceo-jensen-huangs-warning/articleshow/122956208.cms</guid><pubDate>Mon, 28 Jul 2025 19:51:49 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI TECH DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="52102" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122956203,imgsize-52102.cms"/></item><item><title>'Event management': Congress questions timing of 'Op Mahadev'; asks why not earlier?</title><description><![CDATA[Congress leader Udit Raj questioned the timing of the Pahalgam attack mastermind's encounter, suggesting it was orchestrated to coincide with the Parliament debate on Operation Sindoor. He speculated the terrorist was already in custody and the army was instructed to delay action for "event management.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/event-management-congress-leader-udit-raj-questions-timing-of-operation-mahadev-asks-why-not-earlier/articleshow/122967001.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/event-management-congress-leader-udit-raj-questions-timing-of-operation-mahadev-asks-why-not-earlier/articleshow/122967001.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 11:10:49 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1199321" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122967371,imgsize-1199321.cms"/></item><item><title>Jharkhand accident: 5 Kanwariyas dead, 23 hurt in bus-truck collision; CM expresses grief</title><description><![CDATA[A tragic accident occurred in Deoghar's Mohanpur block. A bus carrying Kanwariyas collided with a truck. The collision resulted in the death of six pilgrims. Twenty-four others sustained serious injuries. The accident took place near Jamuniya forest. Rescue operations are underway. Injured individuals are receiving medical treatment at nearby facilities. Authorities are investigating the incident.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/ranchi/jharkhand-accident-bus-carrying-kanwariyas-collides-with-truck-transporting-gas-cylinders-5-dead-several-injured/articleshow/122964810.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/ranchi/jharkhand-accident-bus-carrying-kanwariyas-collides-with-truck-transporting-gas-cylinders-5-dead-several-injured/articleshow/122964810.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 08:33:54 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>ASRP MUKESH</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="86632" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122965115,imgsize-86632.cms"/></item><item><title>Who was Shane Tamura? What we know about the Manhattan building shooter</title><description><![CDATA[A tragic shooting at a Midtown Manhattan office building on Park Avenue resulted in five fatalities, including an NYPD officer and the suspected gunman, Shane Tamura. Tamura, armed with an AR-15-style rifle, opened fire in the building's lobby before taking his own life.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/documented-mental-health-history-who-was-shane-tamura-what-we-know-about-the-manhattan-building-shooter/articleshow/122964669.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/documented-mental-health-history-who-was-shane-tamura-what-we-know-about-the-manhattan-building-shooter/articleshow/122964669.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 09:06:46 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="48484" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122965227,imgsize-48484.cms"/></item><item><title>Birth in space: What happens if a baby is born beyond Earth; risks of pregnancy in orbit</title><description><![CDATA[The possibility of human reproduction in space raises significant biological and technological challenges. Microgravity impacts fetal development and poses logistical difficulties for childbirth, while cosmic radiation threatens DNA and increases the risk of miscarriage and developmental abnormalities. Protecting against radiation and understanding the effects of weightlessness on fetal and infant development are crucial before attempting space pregnancy.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/science/could-a-baby-be-born-in-space-scientist-explains-the-possibility-and-risks-of-space-birth/articleshow/122968544.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/science/could-a-baby-be-born-in-space-scientist-explains-the-possibility-and-risks-of-space-birth/articleshow/122968544.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 12:00:47 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SCIENCE DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="29614" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122968518,imgsize-29614.cms"/></item><item><title>Wankhede Stadium heist: IPL jerseys worth Rs 6.5L stolen from BCCI office; security guard held</title><description><![CDATA[A security guard at the BCCI office in Mumbai has been arrested for allegedly stealing 261 IPL jerseys, valued at Rs 6.52 lakh. Farooque Aslam Khan, the accused, reportedly sold the jerseys to an online dealer to fund his online gambling addiction.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/6-5l-ipl-jerseys-stolen-from-bcci-office-guard-held/articleshow/122958343.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/6-5l-ipl-jerseys-stolen-from-bcci-office-guard-held/articleshow/122958343.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 03:30:06 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>MATEEN HAFEEZ</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="118806" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122966203,imgsize-118806.cms"/></item><item><title>Priya Dutt shares pics of brother Sanjay Dutt on his birthday, writes, “We fight, we laugh, and we cry together..” </title><description><![CDATA[Sanjay Dutt celebrated his 66th birthday, receiving warm wishes from family and fans. His sister, Priya Dutt, shared nostalgic photos and a heartfelt message of love and support. Maanayata Dutt posted a touching video montage of their cherished moments, expressing gratitude for his strength, love, and guidance, followed by a cozy family dinner and cake-cutting ceremony.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/priya-dutt-shares-old-pics-of-brother-sanjay-dutt-on-his-birthday-writes-we-fight-we-laugh-and-we-cry-together-/articleshow/122969290.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/priya-dutt-shares-old-pics-of-brother-sanjay-dutt-on-his-birthday-writes-we-fight-we-laugh-and-we-cry-together-/articleshow/122969290.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 12:27:27 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="24122" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122969334,imgsize-24122.cms"/></item><item><title>Op Mahadev: Pahalgam attack mastermind among 3 terrorists killed, says report - what we know</title><description><![CDATA[In Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, security forces neutralized three terrorists in an intense firefight near Dachigam National Park. Astronauts have successfully cultivated zinnias, sunflowers, and wheat on space stations, offering fresh food, psychological comfort, and life-support benefits. NASA's Veggie project and earlier Soviet experiments demonstrate the feasibility of space farming, paving the way for sustainable deep space exploration and reducing reliance on Earth-based supplies.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/science/nasa-proves-growing-plants-in-space-is-key-to-healthy-astronaut-life-on-mars-missions-and-deep-space-travel/articleshow/122965564.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/science/nasa-proves-growing-plants-in-space-is-key-to-healthy-astronaut-life-on-mars-missions-and-deep-space-travel/articleshow/122965564.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 10:19:26 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SCIENCE DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="41952" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122966402,imgsize-41952.cms"/></item><item><title>India playing XI: Kuldeep in the mix, Akash Deep likely to return; call on Bumrah soon</title><description><![CDATA[With the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy still alive and series on the line, India are expected to veer from its safety-first approach in the fifth Test, starting Thursday at The Oval, and go all-out for the kill to level the series. His early exit highlights the financial uncertainties of short-lived professional sports careers, despite a promising college performance.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/nfl/news/zach-evans-net-worth-in-2025-early-nfl-exit-caps-career-earnings-under-1-million-after-surprise-retirement-with-jets/articleshow/122964181.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/nfl/news/zach-evans-net-worth-in-2025-early-nfl-exit-caps-career-earnings-under-1-million-after-surprise-retirement-with-jets/articleshow/122964181.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 08:30:28 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>GLOBAL SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="40808" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122964178,imgsize-40808.cms"/></item><item><title>'Most influential of last decade': Former IND head coach Ravi Shastri singles out ex-India captain</title><description><![CDATA[Ravi Shastri has praised Virat Kohli, calling him the most influential player of the last decade. Shastri, the former India head coach, made the statement in a recent video on X. He also named Jasprit Bumrah as the bowler he'd least like to face. Shastri reminisced about his career, highlighting his World Cup win.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/news/most-influential-of-the-last-decade-former-india-head-coach-ravi-shastri-singles-out-former-india-captain/articleshow/122964686.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/news/most-influential-of-the-last-decade-former-india-head-coach-ravi-shastri-singles-out-former-india-captain/articleshow/122964686.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 08:48:41 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="71728" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122964874,imgsize-71728.cms"/></item></channel></rss>

      <description><![CDATA[The Genius Act marks a turning point for stablecoins, offering them legal legitimacy and regulatory clarity. “This legitimisation of stablecoins is certainly going to give a huge boost,” says Eswar Prasad, Professor at Cornell University.       <title><![CDATA[SuperK to use ₹100 crore Series B funding to deepen presence in small-town India]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/business/startup/retail-startup-superk-series-b-funding-expansion-small-town-india-19644892.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[SuperK plans to use its ₹100 crore Series B funding to deepen its presence in Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Karnataka, rather than expanding nationwide. “We’re not trying to expand everywhere… the market we’re operating in already has immense depth,” said Neeraj Menta, Co-Founder of SuperK. The value-led retail chain, backed by Binny Bansal and Shubman Gill, will invest in team, tech, and brand-building to scale its small-town retail ecosystem.]]></description>

    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[No interim US-India trade deal yet; Indian exporters brace for 20-25% tariffs as August 1 deadline nears]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/world/india-us-trade-deal-delay-trump-tariffs-impact-exporters-19644819.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[Indian exporters are gearing up for possible US tariffs of 20–25% as the August 1 deadline set by President Trump approaches without an interim trade deal. While the tariff uncertainty has stalled orders, industry leaders say Indian exporters remain competitively placed compared to rivals like Bangladesh and China. Exporters expect the tariffs to impact profit margins more than supply chains, with fresh orders likely once clarity emerges post-deadline. Trade talks are set to resume in August as both countries work toward a broader agreement.]]></description>
      <pubDate><![CDATA[Mon, 28 Jul 2025 23:11:22 +0530]]></pubDate>

      <description><![CDATA[KFin Technologies is holding firm on its FY26 revenue growth guidance of 18–20% despite a weak Q1, with CEO Sreekanth Nadella pointing to seasonal trends and upcoming integration of Ascent Fund Services as key tailwinds. “Q2, Q3, and Q4 are typically much stronger,” he said, adding that yield compression in mutual funds is a strategic trade-off to support client growth.       <title><![CDATA[RBI won the battle against inflation, but the war continues: Sanjay Malhotra]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/economy/rbi-won-the-battle-against-inflation-but-the-war-continues-sanjay-malhotra-19642331.htm]]></link>

      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/market/tata-capital-ipo-valuation-raised-drhp-filing-19642326.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[Sources say the company is likely to file its updated Draft Red Herring Prospectus (DRHP) as early as tomorrow or by the end of this week. Tata Capital plans to raise around $2 billion through the IPO, which is expected to launch in the first half of September this year. The IPO is being driven by a regulatory mandate. In September 2022, the Reserve Bank of India classified Tata Capital as an upper-layer systemically important NBFC, requiring it to go public within three years. That deadline expires this September.]]></description>

      <description><![CDATA[In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Vijay Kumar Arisetty, Founder & CEO of Aurm, unveiled ambitious plans for his private vault company, aiming for 40,000 lockers across 150 sites by March 2026.       <description><![CDATA[IREDA will remain exclusively focused on the renewable energy sector, with no plans to diversify, CMD Pradip Kumar Das told CNBC-TV18. Das also addressed the Gensol case, calling it a result of “promoters’ misgovernance,” but expressed confidence in recovery.
